Rapid overview of the background necessary and of some methods used to prove security of the BB84 quantum key distribution protocol; the talk was aimed at people interested in the quant-ph/0511175 and the Algorithmica 2002 results. arXiv:quant-ph/0511175 [pdf ] : Title: A Proof of the Security of Quantum Key Distribution Authors: Eli Biham, Michel Boyer, P. Boyer (Aug. 2004) This note first defines Sperner systems and presents a proof of Sperner's theorem based on symmetric chains using an approach similar to Griggs' in his article on the distributions of sums or residues modulo q. Then a detailed proof of Grigg's theorem is presented. On Mermin's n-player parity game [pdf], Aug 2004 Author: M. Boyer Comment: Starting from Mermin's 1990 PRL article and trying to be as faithful as possible to his approach, these self-contained notes aim at giving Mermin's article a meaning relevant to pseudo-telepathy games and end with recent results obtained by Brassard, Broadbent and Tapp (quant-ph/0408052). arXiv:quant-ph/0408090 [pdf] : Titre: An extended GHZ n-player game with classical probability of winning tending to 0 Auteur: Michel Boyer (DIRO, Université de Montréal, Montréal, QC) Commentaire: 4 pages RevTeX Algorithmica 2002, Vol 34, No 4.
